project.teaser: We propose alternative approaches to superconducting qubit technology. State-of-the-art implementations require flux-bias lines to tune the qubit frequency. These lines are controlled with currents which can damage qubit performance by inducing undesirable magnetic fields...
project.objective: We propose alternative approaches to superconducting qubit technology. State-of-the-art implementations require flux-bias lines to tune the qubit frequency. These lines are controlled with currents which can damage qubit performance by inducing undesirable magnetic fields. This is detrimental to qubit performance and presents a severe bottleneck for scalability, as these lines are associated with significant heat dissipation. In this project, we advance two novel superconducting qubit designs capable of overcoming this challenge by eliminating the need for flux lines. This will involve the investigation of SIsFS junctions and their integration into quantum processors. One innovation track will implement SIsFS junctions in a transmon geometry—ferrotransmons. The other will hybridize gatemons and π-junction to deliver a ferrogatemon. Three of Europe’s leading quantum startups will integrate these alternative qubit types into prototype full-stack systems to test the implications of these novel approaches on scalability and performance quality.
project.title: Ferrotransmons and Ferrogatemons for Scalable Superconducting Quantum Computers
project.keywords: Quantum computing, Quantum hardware, Qubits, QPU, Transmons, Ferrotransmons, Ferrogatemons, Superconducting Quantum Computers

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan
result.description: Training courses will be organized to improve the consortium's capacity for effective scientific communication. For outreach events like conferences, workshops and summer schools we will create presentations and specialized online educational course materials. This deliverable is complementary to deliverable 6.4.

result.title: Data management Plan
result.description: We will create a central archive to store all of our publicly available output, such as papers and datasets. This will create a centralized location for all project-related publications (scientific articles, pre-prints, patents or conference proceedings, presentations, etc.), complete with automatically populated structured metadata. This is the plan after 6 months.We also take care of RPX update of the Data Management Plan.

result.title: Nanoscale spin ordering and spin screening effects in tunnel ferromagnetic Josephson junctions

details.authors: R. Satariano, A. F. Volkov, H. G. Ahmad, L. Di Palma, R. Ferraiuolo, A. Vettoliere, C. Granata, D. Montemurro, L. Parlato, G. P. Pepe, F. Tafuri, G. Ausanio, and D. Massarotti

result.title: Website and project logo
result.description: In this deliverable we will build a website dedicated to the project and create a logo for the project.

result.title: Scaling of high-quality tunnel ferromagnetic Josephson junctions
result.description: We will design and build prototype ferromagnetic tunable Josephson junctions shaping properties and layout in order to integrate the final device in a fully microwave and/or magnetic field pulses driven transmon. Different ferromagnets will be inserted and investigated in tunnel Al-based Josephson junctions, and a complete characterization of the devices will be delivered.

result.title: Percolative supercurrent in superconductor-ferromagnetic insulator bilayers

details.authors: A. Maiani, A. C. C. Drachmann, L. Galletti, C. Schrade, Y. Liu, R. Seoane Souto, S. Vaitiekėnas

result.title: Evidence of the inverse proximity effect in tunnel magnetic josephson junctions

details.authors: R. Satariano, A. F. Volkov, H. G. Ahmad, L. Di Palma, R. Ferraiuolo, Z. Iqbal, A. Vettoliere, C. Granata, D. Montemurro, L. Parlato, G. P. Pepe, F. Tafuri, G. Ausanio, D. Massarotti

result.title: Phase dynamics of tunnel Al-based ferromagnetic Josephson junction

details.authors: H. G. Ahmad, R. Satariano, R. Ferraiuolo, A. Vettoliere, C. Granata, D. Montemurro, G. Ausanio, L. Parlato, G. P. Pepe, F. Tafuri, and D. Massarotti

result.title: Towards novel tunability schemes for hybrid ferromagnetic transmon qubits

details.authors: H. Ahmad, R. Ferraiuolo, G. Serpico, R. Satariano, A. Levochkina, A. Vettoliere, C. Granata, D. Montemurro, M. Esposito, G. Ausanio, L. Parlato, G.P. Pepe, A. Bruno, F. Tafuri, D. Massarotti

result.title: Integration of tunnel ferromagnetic JJs in 2D and 3D microwave waveguides
result.description: 2D and 3D microwave waveguides with a ferromagnetic JJ will be realized and fully characterized. Magnetic field pulses drive and RF-drive of the ferromagnetic JJ junctions will be optimized in view of the integration of these devices into a multi-qubit configuration. Modelling of the devices will also be delivered.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
